## Natural history notes

Netted Pawpaw (Asimina reticulata), also called Dog-banana, is a perennial shrub noted for it's showy white flowers that bloom from late winter to early spring. Netted Pawpaw is a host plant for Zebra Swallowtail and Pawpaw Sphinx lepidopterans, and is pollinated by a variety of fly and beetle species in Florida. Netted Pawpaw prefers sandy and acidic soils with good drainage.
